list_definition.definition: a fall or shower of snow that settles on the ground

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: There was a heavy snowfall last night.

list_definition.definition: the amount of snow that falls in a certain place

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The snowfall last year was much higher than average.

list_ex_of_english: I am thinking especially of a line which joins villages which are often isolated in winter by heavy snowfalls.
However, cotyledons did not emerge prior to snowfall.
What will happen if we have another snowfall like the one that we had recently?
One woman recalled an incident on the farm not long after a heavy snowfall.
If there are serious snowfalls resulting in abnormal expenditure, then the whole situation will have to be examined.
There has been less snowfall and what has fallen has been melting quicker than it used to melt.
What already promised to be a poor harvest was then followed by an early snowfall that buried the crop before it could be harvested.

By contrast, relatively harsh winters can occur in some of the more elevated areas of its distribution, coincidentally the sites with higher parasitism rates, with snowfalls and frequent freezing temperatures.
